author: @ilsussidiario
title: GUERRA A GAZA/ "Netanyahu non vuole l'accordo, Hamas neppure, Biden ne parla solo per aiutare Harris"
text: Molte volte sembrava sul punto di essere firmato. In realtà, l’accordo tra Israele e Hamas per il cessate il fuoco a Gaza e la liberazione degli ostaggi molto probabilmente non si farà. Sia da una parte che dall’altra, spiega Vincenzo Giallongo, generale dei Carabinieri in congedo con all’attivo missioni in Iraq, Albania, Kuwait e Kosovo, vengono indicate richieste e condizioni che non si realizzeranno mai. E anche le pressioni che gli americani ufficialmente stanno esercitando affinché si arrivi almeno a una tregua, fanno il paio con l’invio di armi a Israele e l’arrivo nel Medio Oriente della portaerei USS Lincoln, chiari segnali che Tel Aviv potrà continuare ad avere il sostegno USA nella guerra. Insomma, lo scenario è di un conflitto che rischia di continuare fino a quando [Netanyahu](https://www.ilsussidiario.net/news/israele-hamas-luscita-di-ganz-ha-aumentato-i-consensi-di-netanyahu-ora-vince-la-soluzione-militare/2742344/) avrà deciso di aver inflitto abbastanza perdite ad Hamas. Anche [l’Iran,](https://www.ilsussidiario.net/news/israele-hamas-e-iran-i-nemici-che-stanno-salvando-lo-stato-ebraico-dalla-disgregazione/2741365/) nonostante sia tornato a minacciare ritorsioni contro Israele dopo l’uccisione di Haniyeh a Teheran, in realtà è conscio della sua inferiorità militare rispetto agli israeliani. Chi non si tira indietro, invece, è Hezbollah, che nelle ultime ore ha lanciato 150 razzi verso Israele. Biden ha telefonato a Netanyahu per sollecitare l’accordo con Hamas. Un altro bluff? L’accordo non si farà mai: Israele non vuole assolutamente che Hamas metta piede nel governo di Gaza e continuerà a presidiare parti della Striscia; Hamas, invece, non riconosce Israele e, appunto, vuole avere un ruolo nel governo di Gaza. Due modi di vedere incompatibili, per questo l’intesa non ci sarà. Tel Aviv proseguirà verso la distruzione totale di Hamas, almeno per il 70-80%, o comunque fino a una percentuale che soddisfi il governo israeliano. Anche se per gli anni a venire questo significa che ci saranno ancora degli attentati. Non vedo comunque la possibilità di una pace. Netanyahu avrebbe incontrato il ministro Smotrich, secondo Times of Israel, per cercare di capire fino a che punto l’estrema destra che fa parte del suo governo è in grado di accettare un accordo. È anche per questo che alla fine non ci arriva? Nel suo esecutivo ci sono forze che non lo vogliono? Netanyahu è il primo che non vuole la pace perché per lui vorrebbe dire andare a casa. Questo anche se i sondaggi lo danno in risalita: l’opinione pubblica, quando c’è una guerra, si stringe attorno al leader e mette da parte le difficoltà. Ma basterà poco e torneranno in auge tutte le critiche che gli sono state rivolte. Ricordiamo Churchill: ha vinto la guerra e non le successive elezioni. Da più parti si sostiene ormai che i negoziati stanno fallendo, perché invece ufficialmente sia Biden che Blinken usano toni forti, spingendo perché si arrivi all’accordo? Cercano di tranquillizzare l’opinione pubblica americana per venderlo come risultato anche della nuova candidata dem alla Casa Bianca. Proveranno fino in fondo a portare Israele ad accettare la pace. Anche se poi bisogna vedere se Hamas sarà dello stesso parere. La verità è che non ci credono tanto neanche gli americani, non per niente hanno inviato nella zona due portaerei, 50 aerei, un sommergibile. D’altra parte, non ci si può aspettare niente di buono neanche sull’altro fronte: Hezbollah ha appena lanciato 150 razzi verso il Nord Israele: non è il modo migliore per una pace condivisa. L’unico modo degli USA per convincere Israele sarebbe non fornire più le armi? In teoria sì, ma come fanno a non dargliele? Sarebbe un modo per impedire a Israele di continuare. Non perché gli israeliani non sappiano produrle: il più grande mercato delle armi a livello mondiale è in Israele. Il problema è che non è detto che riescano a farlo nelle quantità necessarie. Ma gli Stati Uniti non possono dire: “Non ti forniamo più armamenti e ti lasciamo in balìa dei nemici”. Non è una possibilità che potrebbe essere presa in considerazione, sarebbe una eventualità che andrebbe contro tutti gli interessi occidentali nell’area. Non si potrebbe ricondurre Israele a più miti consigli, a un modo meno brutale di perseguire i suoi obiettivi militari? Israele sta un po’ esagerando, anche se è brutto dirlo in questi termini. Anche Hamas dovrebbe fare un passo indietro: è molto più facile da tacitare. E se veramente il mondo arabo volesse, lo farebbe. È più facile controllare loro che non tacitare uno Stato intero. Il problema è che molti Paesi della regione sembrano più impegnati a non avere troppe seccature che a risolvere veramente la questione palestinese. L’Iran intanto è tornato a minacciare una rappresaglia nei confronti di Israele sostenendo che potrebbe arrivare dal cielo, ma anche dal mare e dalla terra. Scatta nuovamente l’allarme escalation? L’Iran continua a menare il can per l’aia e ancora non si è mosso. Sa benissimo che, se dovesse eccedere in un attacco, rischierebbe di prendere una batosta da cui non si rialzerebbe. [Teheran](https://www.ilsussidiario.net/news/attacco-iran-israele-e-lunico-paese-che-ha-ancora-interesse-ad-allargare-la-guerra/2738614/) non ha l’atomica, l’unica cosa che potrebbe consentire di incutere terrore nell’area. E tutti sono decisi a fermare il processo che potrebbe portare gli iraniani a costruirla. Gli iraniani sanno di essere inferiori militarmente a Israele e quindi non si muoveranno? Sì. Al di là dei droni, le truppe non sono addestrate e non hanno armamenti leggeri. Anche l’Iraq stava vincendo la guerra contro di loro, poi Saddam si è trovato senza uomini perché una grossa parte della sua popolazione era sciita e non voleva combattere contro l’Iran. Teheran ha ricevuto pressioni da USA e Paesi europei per non dare il via all’escalation del conflitto nella regione. Ha subito anche quelle dei russi, alleati sul fronte siriano e destinatari delle forniture di droni usati in Ucraina? Iraniani e russi sono sicuramente amici. Anche Mosca potrebbe aver detto all’Iran di non attaccare: la Russia ha già diversi problemi e non penso che voglia andarsene a creare altri. Devono pensare all’Ucraina, stanno cercando di espandersi in Africa: hanno altro da fare. E poi le ritorsioni si fanno nell’immediatezza dei fatti: gli iraniani dovevano rispondere subito dopo la morte di Haniyeh. (Paolo Rossetti) — — — — Abbiamo bisogno del tuo contributo per continuare a fornirti una informazione di qualità e indipendente.

author: EÑE
title: Defecar en las piscinas: la moda nacida en 2019 que ya ha afectado a tres municipios del alfoz
text:
Defecar en las piscinas: la moda nacida en 2019 que ya ha afectado a tres municipios del alfoz
Varios municipios de Salamanca vuelven a enfrentarse a actos incívicos en sus piscinas públicas, obligando al cierre temporal y a intensos procesos de limpieza y desinfección
Cabrerizos / Carbajosa
Jueves, 3 de julio 2025, 06:00
El reto viral de defecar en las piscinas públicas se puso de moda en 2019 y, en Salamanca, sigue vivo seis años después.
Cabrerizos fue el primer municipio en padecer esta gamberrada en julio de 2019, en uno de los días más calurosos. La situación se repitió en julio de 2020 hasta en dos ocasiones: una el día 7 y otra el 23. Cabe recordar que, en el verano de 2020, las piscinas públicas eran un espacio al aire libre muy demandado debido a la situación de pandemia y la reciente salida del confinamiento.
De inmediato, los servicios municipales actuaron y pusieron en marcha todos los protocolos con las medidas higienizantes y de desinfección requeridas para dejar limpio el vaso y listo para su apertura en la jornada siguiente. El entonces alcalde en funciones, Jesús Quintero, definió la situación como «un acto ajeno a la responsabilidad municipal y solo achacable a la falta de consideración y responsabilidad de un individuo».
El año pasado fue Carbajosa de la Sagrada la que padeció, los días 25 y 26 de julio, la misma situación, lo que obligó al cierre de las instalaciones para realizar el filtrado, la limpieza y la depuración intensiva del agua, de forma que se garantizase a los usuarios que la calidad del agua estaba en óptimo estado de limpieza y con los niveles de cloro y pH correctos.

author: Europe 1 avec AFP
title: États-Unis : les salariés de Boeing votent massivement pour la grève, la direction veut négocier
text:
Les travailleurs ont rejeté la convention à 94,6% et voté jeudi soir la grève à 96%, a précisé Jon Holden, président du syndicat des machinistes IAM-District 751. "Nous ferons grève à minuit", soit à 07H00 GMT vendredi, a-t-il ajouté. "Nos membres se sont exprimés haut et fort ce soir", a affirmé Jon Holden, dont le syndicat qui représente environ 33.000 travailleurs dans la région Nord-Ouest Pacifique, avait initialement soutenu l'accord. Jon Holden avait auparavant déclaré ne pas pouvoir "garantir que nous obtiendrons davantage en faisant grève".
Une grève de 50 jours priverait Boeing de 3 à 3,5 milliards de dollars de liquidités
La grève entraînera la fermeture de deux grandes usines d'assemblage d'avions dans la région de Puget Sound - les deux tiers des votes étaient nécessaires pour lancer un arrêt de travail dès l'expiration jeudi à minuit de la convention actuelle, vieille de 16 ans. Elle va paralyser la production du 737, du 777 et du 767 cargo, dont les livraisons cumulent déjà les retards. Une situation d'autant plus problématique que l'avionneur encaisse la plus grosse partie du paiement (environ 60%) à la remise des avions.
En dépit du vote massif en faveur de la grève, le groupe Boeing a déclaré dans un communiqué être "engagé" dans la négociation. "Nous restons déterminés à rétablir nos relations avec nos employés et le syndicat, et nous sommes prêts à retourner à la table des négociations pour parvenir à un nouvel accord", a affirmé l'avionneur.
Selon les analystes de TD Cowen, une grève de 50 jours priverait Boeing de 3 à 3,5 milliards de dollars de liquidités et aurait un impact de 5,5 milliards sur le chiffre d'affaires. Le vote de jeudi marque un rejet décisif d'un accord qui, selon les travailleurs, était bien moins généreux que ne l'affirmaient les dirigeants de Boeing.
Cette nouvelle convention, qui concerne les adhérents de l'IAM dans la région de Seattle (nord-ouest), prévoyait une hausse salariale de 25% sur quatre ans ainsi qu'un engagement d'investissements dans la région. Et aussi la construction du prochain avion - annoncé pour 2035 - dans le berceau historique de l'avionneur qui devait assurer des emplois pour plusieurs décennies.
Dernière grève en 2008
Boeing espérait que ces concessions suffiraient à esquiver une grève, alors que sa situation financière est précaire depuis le crash de deux 737 MAX 8 en 2018 et en 2019, ayant coûté la vie à 346 personnes, et une multitude de problèmes de qualité de la production. "Ce n'est un secret pour personne : notre activité traverse une période difficile, en partie à cause de nos propres erreurs du passé. (...) Une grève mettrait en péril notre reprise commune", avait prévenu mercredi soir Kelly Ortberg, qui a succédé le 8 août à Dave Calhoun au poste de directeur général de l'avionneur américain.
Il avait exhorté les employés à ne pas "sacrifier" les progrès futurs en raison de "frustrations liées au passé". Mais les mécontents jugent la hausse salariale trop éloignée des demandes du syndicat (+40% initialement) et le volet sur les retraites insatisfaisant.
Une semaine après sa prise de fonction, Kelly Ortberg s'était engagé à "réinitialiser" la relation avec l'IAM. Mais à la lecture de l'accord, de nombreux syndiqués ont réagi négativement et plaidé pour un arrêt de travail. "On nous a bradés", a lancé jeudi à l'AFP Kamie Bryan, employée chez Boeing depuis 18 ans, après avoir voté contre l'accord et pour la grève. "Nous ne devrions pas prendre ces quelques sous qu'ils nous donnent et être reconnaissants", a-t-elle relevé, insistant sur l'ampleur des "revenus du patron".
"Ils parlent d'une augmentation de 25%, mais ce n'est pas le cas", a déclaré Paul Janousek, un électricien d'Everett qui a voté en faveur de la grève après avoir estimé que la présentation de Boeing était "trompeuse". Selon M. Janousek, 55 ans, employé chez Boeing depuis 13 ans, son augmentation ne serait en réalité que d'environ 9%, compte tenu de la suppression de la prime annuelle.
Des rassemblements quotidiens d'ouvriers dans les usines
Les télévisions ont montré des rassemblements quotidiens d'ouvriers protestant dans les usines contre des mesures salariales qu'ils estiment inadéquates face à l'inflation. Après des grèves dans les secteurs de l'automobile, du divertissement et d'autres secteurs d'activité, les syndicats engagent ainsi un nouveau bras de fer. Le règlement de l'IAM prévoit que les grévistes reçoivent 250 dollars par semaine à partir de la troisième semaine d'arrêt de travail.
Boeing fait l'objet d'une supervision accrue depuis un incident en vol début janvier sur un 737 MAX 9 d'Alaska Airlines. Survenu après une série de problèmes de conformité et de contrôle qualité, il a ravivé les questions soulevées sur ces mêmes lacunes après les deux crashes. La dernière grève chez l'avionneur américain remonte à 2008 et avait duré 57 jours.

author: francaisenouvelles
title: La côte californienne battue par des vagues massives
text:
Massive waves flood California beach towns as evacuations ordered
Forecasters say waves as high as 40 feet are possible Thursday in some locations along the California coast, with another round of swells set to arrive Saturday.
SAN FRANCISCO – Up and down the
California coast, monster waves battered beach towns Thursday churned up by a powerful storm in the Pacific Ocean.
From
San Diego to Los Angeles and beyond San Francisco, the National Weather Service issued Coastal Flood Warnings and High Surf Warnings for breaking waves between 28 and 33 feet. Some locations were forecast to see waves as high as 40 feet.
The massive waves overtook
beaches and coastal roads. Some even crashed against homes and businesses.
The debris deposited on streets was so heavy that road crews used plows to clear the scenic State Highway 1, south of San Francisco. Other stretches of the road were too buried to clear.
CALIFORNIA BEACH HOME TO SOME OF LARGEST WAVES IN THE WORLD
Officials issued evacuation orders for several northern and central California coastal communities.
"We put evacuation warnings into place around 8 a.m. this morning for this area, and, as you can see, these waves are incredibly powerful," Ashley Keehn, the
Santa Cruz County Sheriff's Office Information Officer, told KTVU FOX 2. "They're washing logs up here. A lot of debris, a lot of driftwood. So we've been asking people to avoid the direct coastal area." HOW WEATHER IMPACTS WAVES DURING SURFING COMPETITIONS
Not everyone heeded the advice, however, and ended up soaked.
ACTIVE EL NINO PATTERN DELIVERS WITH SURF AS HIGH AS 50 FEET IN PACIFIC STRONG EL NINO WINTER: WHAT KIND OF WEATHER YOU CAN EXPECT
The waves kept coming. Take a look at this aerial picture of
Ventura, California. The swells come in sets, one after another.
Ventura County
rescue crews were kept busy with both rescues and injury calls as waves smashed windows and glass doors of homes and swept onlookers off piers and beaches.
A wave in Ventura County, north of Los Angeles, topped the pier. The NWS estimated that it was 20 feet high.
WATCH: MASSIVE ROGUE WAVE BATTERS CRUISE SHIP IN NORTH SEA
Coastal Flood
Warnings and High Surf Warnings in Northern California expire late Thursday and early Friday morning. The NWS warned that the next set of big swells will arrive Saturday. The Los Angeles NWS office is not taking any chances, and Southern California warnings are in place through Saturday night. The worst of the flooding occurs at high tide.

author: STERN.de
title: Arbeitskampf: Tarifeinigung für Dönerfabrik Birtat
text:
Die Beschäftigten beim Dönerspieß-Hersteller Birtat zerkleinern Fleisch, marinieren und stecken es dann auf die Spieße - ein Knochenjob. Für sie gilt künftig nach Gewerkschaftsangaben der erste Tarifvertrag in der Dönerfleischindustrie. In ihm wurde der Einstiegslohn auf 2.600 Euro festgelegt, wie die Gewerkschaft Nahrung-Genuss-Gaststätten (NGG) und das Unternehmen Meat World SE (Birtat) in Murr bei Ludwigsburg gemeinsam mitteilten. Für Betriebsratschef Muzayfe Doganer ist mit dem Haustarifvertrag "ein Traum" wahr geworden. "Ich wollte weinen." Er sei stolz auf die rund 120 Mitarbeiter. Es sei ein Ergebnis, das für beide Seiten gut sei.
Ferner sei eine Anhebung der Entgelte in zwei Stufen im Gesamtumfang von bis zu 17 Prozent in der Spitze bei einer Laufzeit bis Ende 2026 vereinbart worden, wie beide Seiten mitteilten.
Die Gewerkschaft NGG hatte eine Erhöhung der Entgelte um monatlich 375 Euro und einen Tarifvertrag gefordert. Die Beschäftigten legten ihre Arbeit an elf unterschiedlichen Tagen zeitweise nieder.
NGG-Verhandlungsführerin Magdalena Krüger sagte, dieser Tarifabschluss sei ein historisches Ergebnis in der Dönerfleischbranche und ein Erfolg der Beschäftigten.
Unternehmenssprecher Cihan Karaman sagte laut der gemeinsamen Mitteilung: "Wir sind überzeugt, dass dieser Vertrag nicht nur Planungssicherheit schafft, sondern auch das Vertrauen und die Zusammenarbeit zwischen Unternehmen und Beschäftigten stärkt." Der Vertrag ist ein Haustarifvertrag, weil er zwischen der Gewerkschaft und dem Unternehmen abgeschlossen worden ist.
Verband: 400 Dönerhersteller in Deutschland
Die Tarifauseinandersetzung wurde in den vergangenen Wochen mit harten Bandagen geführt. Beide Seiten mussten Zugeständnisse machen. In der zweiten Urabstimmung votierten rund 90 Prozent der befragten NGG-Mitglieder für die Annahme des Tarifvertrags.
Die Tarifparteien verpflichten sich zudem, nun über einen Tarifvertrag zur Eingruppierung sowie einen Manteltarifvertrag zu verhandeln. Die Gewerkschaft hofft, dass sie künftig gleichfalls bei anderen Unternehmen der Branche tarifvertragliche Regelungen durchsetzen kann. DGB-Landeschef Kai Burmeister sagte, der Tarifabschluss bei Birtat sei ein toller und hart erkämpfter Erfolg für die Beschäftigten und die NGG. Birtat gehört zur Meat World SE, nach NGG-Angaben der größte Hersteller von Dönerspießen in Baden-Württemberg - und einer der führenden Anbieter in Deutschland. In der Fabrik stecken die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter Fleisch vom Kalb, Hähnchen oder Rind auf Spieße - und geben dem Ganzen die traditionelle Form. Die Spieße werden dann schockgefrostet und ausgeliefert.
Birtat versorgt nach eigenen Angaben Tausende Imbisse und erreicht mehr als 13 Millionen Konsumentinnen und Konsumenten monatlich. "Unsere Produkte kann man fast in jeder großen Stadt in Europa verkosten", sagte ein Firmensprecher kürzlich. Man sei Marktführer. Meat World machte demnach zuletzt einen Jahresumsatz von ungefähr 200 Millionen Euro. Nach Angaben des Verbands der Dönerproduzenten gibt es etwa 400 Dönerhersteller hierzulande.

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: 环球网
title: 暑假刚玩几天，就进入"全天学习状态"！杭州妈妈：比上学还累|小升初_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
来源：潮新闻
“小升初的暑假，家长也要转变心态，不能玩玩闹闹的了。”家住杭州市临平区的王女士，家里有个正在过小升初暑假的儿子。这两天，王女士和几个妈妈们聊天后感慨颇多，“小升初的暑假承上启下很重要，孩子们要学习、预习的内容很多，家长们的心态也要一起跟着转变。”
“除了预习初一的课本，我们开始带孩子长跑。体育就是要多跑步、练耐力，开学就要毅行12公里，我们得抓紧练体能了，不然到时候晕倒就太难看了。”同样是新初一孩子的妈妈张女士，也有很多心得。
不过，也有家长吐槽，说收到了学校整整两页A4纸的暑假作业，不仅有背诵古诗词、背诵单词，还要求孩子每天练字《初中生新课标必背古诗文》田英章字帖，每天一页。“要求多，任务重，感觉短短的暑假比一学期的学习还累！娃就刚刚放假玩了几天，这阵子已经进入全天学习的状态了。”家住西湖区的沈女士对潮新闻记者说。
小升初的这些孩子们的暑假，都是怎么过的？
切换成“困难模式” 每天都要打卡练习
受访者供图 家住拱墅区的陆女士，夫妻俩是双职工，儿子阳阳是个很自觉的孩子，在班里成绩一直保持上游。
小升初的暑假，阳阳先上了10天夏令营，集中上课学习。然后只休息了几天，就开始打卡完成新初一老师布置的各科作业。可谓是马不停蹄，说是暑假，更像是初一“预备役”，每天的安排和开学无异。
早上是数学《从自然数到有理数》、语文基础，下午是英语上第一单元的预习、科学第一单元，还有一个文综的作业《地球的宇宙环境》。
陆女士一边上班，一边“遥控”看家长助手上孩子的打卡情况，数学的作业被打了回去，要求孩子看解析再重新提交。“遥控其实挺难的，好在我儿子很自觉，也是个会学习，对自己要求高的孩子。”陆女士说，“我们有认识的同学妈妈就很苦恼，孩子的打卡情况一塌糊涂，工作、陪娃无法兼顾。”
阳阳心态倒是很好，觉得这样每天打卡，反而可以提高效率，比纯靠自己制作学习计划要好。
记者发现，新初一的暑假作业，各区每个学校都有自己的侧重点，尤其是语文，有些学校就很强调课外阅读书籍的数量以及硬笔书法的练习。
受访者供图 王女士家对口的初中，语文作业的第一项就是“静心好字”，练习硬笔书法，开学后上交最满意的作品20页，每页不少于100字，作品内容可以为名著中的片段。
“小学的时候，暑假老师也会要求孩子写字，但一般就是一张作品，这次要交20页，对于硬笔书法基础不好的孩子来说，也是一个大工程了。”王女士说。不过，有资深初中班主任表示，硬笔书法过关的孩子，答题卷面分就是会比字写得潦草的孩子要高，小升初这个暑假，再好好抓一下硬笔书法，是个投入小、回报大的“作业”，还能让孩子收收心。
除了练字，七年级上的必读、选读书目，也多了许多。比如《朝花夕拾》《西游记》《白洋淀纪事》《湘行散记》《繁星春水》《新月集》……还会要求孩子阅读杂志、报纸，关注时事新闻。“我们订《钱江晚报》很多年，《成长读本》每期必看，也算是给孩子补充阅读量了。”王女士说。
练体能提上日程，学习、锻炼两手抓
“我们的暑假安排是娃自己做的，比小学时候的课表还满，尤其是早上七点就得起来跑步，还好小区里有跑团，让娃和同学结伴去跑，我们也放心。”家住西湖区的沈女士告诉潮新闻记者，老师下发的作业里，对于体育有明确的要求，男生每天跳绳500个或者深蹲50个，1000米4分30秒，跳跃50个，坐位体前屈20厘米，俯卧撑20个，引体向上10个。
她家儿子的体育成绩属于马马虎虎，1分钟跳绳也仅仅只能达标，这个暑假她给孩子报了一个训练孩子体适能的健身课，想着小升初这个暑假，把孩子的体能拉上去，“对长身体也有好处，耐力提升了，今后学习强度加大了，体能也能跟得上。”沈女士说。
受访者供图 和沈女士不谋而合的还有张女士，开学学校就要求12公里的毅行，7月已经过半，孩子每天的计划都排得满满当当。“跑步是必须的，他们学校这个毅行，我是真怕我女儿会吃不消。”张女士说，现在每天早上她爸爸带着跑步，晚上吃好晚饭就一家人出去骑行，“骑行的这一个小时，是我女儿暑假里最开心的时刻了，很放松，骑行的路线也是她定的。”
小升初的暑假，对很多家庭来说，俨然按下了一个“加速键”，家长们的心态也悄然转变，从“放养”到“规划”，正经历着从“小学生”到“初中生”的关键蜕变。
也有孩子悄悄给妈妈留下“我好累啊”的小纸条，孩子们对待假期的心态也要适时改变，不仅要在跑道上挥汗如雨，也要在书桌前啃掉难题，这或许是孩子们第一次感受到需要自己“咬牙坚持”了，爸妈或许还能做你的“破风手”，但赛道上拼尽全力要靠自己。
潮新闻 记者 王金帅

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Woman inspires with strength, faith
text: WINTERVILLE — A woman’s unshakable faith and a pact she made with God has empowered her to walk with him every day and inspire others along the way. Martha Taylor, 65, began walking regularly at Winterville’s Hillcrest Park to prepare for bilateral knee surgery. Along the way, she learned she had breast cancer. She made a promise to God that if he brought her safely through the journey she would walk 5 miles every day in his name. Since then, not a morning has passed when she hasn’t visited the park for her daily walk. “I started walking in 2017 to lose weight to have knee surgery, then I found out I had breast cancer, and it was all a tough time,” Taylor said. “I promised the Lord that when I got through with it, that I was going to walk with him, rain, sleet, snow or hail, I did, and I’ve been doing every day ever since.” Taylor also has two sons and two granddaughters to live for and she keeps a positive attitude for their sake as well. One of her sons was in the United States Air Force, and Taylor said that she had to assure him that she was fine so that he could focus on protecting the country and not worry about her. Taylor had 34 sessions of chemo; she said that the last four sessions were the roughest, but she went to every visit with a positive attitude. “Every day I went in there I had a smile on my face, and when you go in there, you’re going to always meet a lot of people going through the same thing you’re going through,” said Taylor. “Everyone tries to lift each other up, it’s like it’s a family or sisterhood, you exchange phone numbers, and you try to lift each other’s spirits up.” Taylor proudly wears pink, the color of breast cancer awareness, as well as pins and buttons. She said 2023 was especially difficult for her but inspired her to continue advocating for the cause. “It was hard for me because during the time that I was battling with my breast cancer, at the same time, my sister was in stage 3 breast cancer, and we lost our sister May of this year,” Taylor said. “It’s important that you do self-examinations and do your mammogram every year the way you’re supposed to, and make sure that they find it early because early detection is the key. Taylor has kept her promise to God, she said. Every day she walks at least five miles around the track at Hillcrest Park, and her daily treks haven’t gone unnoticed. Diane White is the new Parks and Recreation Director in Winterville, and her staff mentioned to her that she needs to meet Martha Taylor. “They said that she walks five to six miles a day, that she had an interesting story, and so I was curious,” said White. “I decided to go out there myself and meet her, because I like meeting new people, to see new faces, it brightens my day, and I always learn something new.” White said that one morning she drove out to the park, walked up to Taylor who had already started her walk, and introduced herself. White walked the track with Taylor and learned about her journey through both knee surgeries, her cancer battle, and the promises Taylor made to God. “Every day when she wakes up, she would make sure she would get her walk in, and she’s just a fabulous woman who has a young spirit,” said White. Taylor is so vibrant that her energy is infectious and touches the lives of other people she meets. Quaniqua Staton said she has been coming to the park for years to exercise. She got teary-eyed talking about Taylor. “I think she’s the strongest woman I know. She’s resilient, and rain, sleet, or snow, she’s here,” said Staton. “I don’t care if it’s 100 degrees or 30 degrees, Miss Martha is here.” Staton said that Taylor is going to make sure that she gets those steps in, and that even when Taylor couldn’t drive to the park, she watched Taylor walk there daily. “Miss Martha keeps me going and motivated,” said Staton. “She walked through cancer and knee surgeries, and it motivates me when I come to work out because I know Miss Martha is going to be here.” Barbara P. Coston is another local who comes to the park to walk and for a bit of quiet time. “I have really been inspired by Miss Martha and just watching her walk and just be so consistent,” said Coston. Coston was so inspired that she went to work and told her coworkers all about Taylor. She said that Taylor was diligent and faithful and was happy to share her story. “People can learn from Miss Martha that they can do anything if they set their mind to it, and if they remain faithful, diligent and committed, that they could do what Miss Martha is doing,” said Coston. “And also get the reward of the benefits that she gets from exercising and doing what she does.” Taylor said that many days she feels immense pain in her legs, her knees and her arms. She may take little breaks, but she pushes through and keeps on walking. “I think about the people who don’t have the ability to walk, and I thank God for the pain,” said Taylor. “I thank him that I have limbs that function, and if I feel the pain, I’m grateful that I can feel it, and I keep it moving.” White said she has met others who have met Taylor and have been inspired by her to persevere through challenges they face. “I mean this is just a great story to the extent of, no matter what, you can just wake up every day, be excited that you woke up, and you can start your day with a walk,” said White. “which is truly a blessing because everyone can’t do that.” Taylor said that many days she was hurting and in pain, but she still got up to keep her promise to God. If you lay in the bed and wallow, there’s nowhere else to go but the grave, she said. “That’s what gets me up a lot of days,” said Taylor. “You can lay in the bed and have a pity party, or you can get up, go walk, be thankful, be around other people, be happy, that’s what gets me up, and I walk with God every day.” Subscribe to The Daily Reflector
